UPDATED: April 13, 2021

This online course is conducted through asynchronous (“on-demand”) learning methods:
- The course will mainly be implemented through Luna. All materials, assessments, and communications will be provided there. Check the “URL links”
field below for our course Luna homepage.
- Materials will be posted on Tuesday for each weekly session. The first session is Tuesday, April 20th; however, Luna might not be available then,
so the Week 1 materials will also be provided on OneDrive (see the URL link below).
- Most weekly sessions will include an academic English reading (usually 8 - 15 pages) and a narrated PowerPoint lecture video.
- Three sessions will be used to complete Luna tests, each covering 3 weeks of the course.
- The final session will introduce the Reflective Written Assignment.

NOTE 1: This online course has a heavy academic English reading demand. Students should have sufficient English ability to understand long academic English texts and the motivation to engage with course content in English.

NOTE 2: The course time lost from the first canceled lesson (April 13) has been accounted for in the study time required in the remaining 13 lessons. No additional make-up lessons will be necessary.
